title: Masked Singer Australia's Paulini backtracks after accidentally revealing the identity of 'Monster'
text:
The Masked Singer Australia star Paulini has protested her innocence after she accidentally gave away one of the identities of the remaining celebrities.

The Australian songstress, who was unmasked as 'Spider' on Tuesday's show, made the accidental revelation after being tricked into confirming who 'Monster' was ahead of the grand finale.

But on Wednesday, Paulini strenuously denied letting the spoiler slip, saying she had 'zero idea' who the remaining celebrities were.

Revealed! Australian songstress Paulini (pictured) was unmasked as 'Spider' on Tuesday's show ahead of the grand finale

Appearing on 2Day FM's Hughesy & Kate Show, the 37-year-old singer reacted to the suggestion she had given the game away.

'No I didn't [confirm Monster's identity]. I swear I didn't,' she told host Dave Hughes.

'I have no idea. I actually have zero idea on who the identity of the remaining celebrities are.'

The Project's Gorgi Coghlan has long been rumoured to be the mystery singer under the pink Monster costume, with both fans and judges making the suggestion.

Backtracking! Paulini had been doing the media rounds when she accidentally gave away one of the identities of the remaining celebrities

I promise! Paulini (pictured) said: 'I actually have zero idea on who the identity of the remaining celebrities are'

Fans were quick to point out Paulini's apparent slip-up when she appeared on Newcastle's Hit106.9 on Wednesday.

The show's host Nick Gil asked her to weigh in on the speculation that Gorgi was 'Monster'.

He asked the former Young Divas star: 'I couldn’t believe that Gorgi Coghlan could sing. Could you believe that?'

Paulini reacted by saying: 'I couldn’t either, I think that’s amazing! I was actually blown away by a few of the celebs on the show.'

Spoiler alert! Radio host Nick Gil asked Paulini to weigh in on the speculation that Gorgi Coghlan (pictured) was 'Monster'

But now, Paulini says she thought Nick was asking her about pop singer Deni Hines - who had already been unmasked as 'Unicorn'.

Explaining what happened, she told Dave: 'I actually thought he had said Deni and I was just saying "oh yeah, girl can sing and that's pretty much what I said".'

She goes on to say she would 'swear on the bible' to prove she was in the dark about the remaining contestants.

So that's who it was! Paulini says she thought she was being asked about pop singer Deni Hines (pictured) - who had already been unmasked as 'Unicorn'.

Spectacular: Singer Deni Hines wowed in her unicorn costume as she performed on The Masked Singer Australia

There are only three stars left to be unmasked on the show: Monster, Robot and Wolf.

Most fans are convinced Wolf is Rob Mills, while all clues for Robot appear to point towards Cody Simpson.

The Masked Singer Australia finale airs on Monday from 7.30pm on Channel 10
description: The Masked Singer Australia star Paulini has protested her innocence after she accidentally gave away one of the identities of the remaining celebrities.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
